snippet: Legal experts said they were unaware of any Maryland case in which a criminal co-defendant had been forced to testify before his own trial, and the judge who issued the order seemed to agree.
abstract: Judge Barry G Williams rules Baltimore Police Officer William G Porter, whose trial for his role in 2015 death of Freddie Gray ended with deadlocked jury, must testify in trials of fellow Officers Caesar R Goodson Jr and Alicia D White; legal experts say testimony would be first time in Maryland criminal co-defendant has testified while awaiting his own re-trial; lawyers for Williams say they will appeal.
lead_paragraph: Legal experts said they were unaware of any Maryland case in which a criminal co-defendant had been forced to testify before his own trial, and the judge who issued the order seemed to agree.

headline.main: Baltimore Officer Must Testify in Colleagues’ Trials in Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Officer Must Testify in Colleagues’ Trials
